Hi Bob Jimola,      Could you please confirm that the pedals are connected directly to a rear motherboard USB 3.0 (blue) port, and that you are not using a USB hub? When multiple devices are connected through a hub, power instability may occur, which can cause other USB devices to disconnect.  In addition, our controller box is CE EMI certified and is designed not to interfere with other USB devices.  To help us further diagnose the issue, please record a short video demonstrating the problem and share it with us via Google Drive, making sure the link is set to view access. Our engineers will review the video and provide you with a solution.

Hi Bob Jimola,     You can install the VAM Pro motor using nylon screws and nylon washers to isolate potential electrical interference. Based on the product design and testing, it’s not possible for the product to exhibit so many issues simultaneously—unless the problem was caused by incorrect sensor wiring order during installation.  Please note that different sensors may use different pin orders, typically including GND, 5V, S+, and S-. If the wiring order is incorrect or mismatched, it can damage the control board, which may lead to abnormal behavior.         You can refer to the post below and connect the three metal screws on the PC case, control box, and pedals, which should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding
